Sentencas: In this work, direct electrophoretic deposition (EPD) of thin-film Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) elec-trolyte on porous nonconductive NiO-BaCe0.8Sm0.2O3 (BCS) and NiO-SDC substrates is studied.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: To improve the electrolyte sintering, the suspensions for EPD have been modified by the addition of Co3O4, TiO2, and Al2O3 oxides in the amount of 2, 2 and 5 mol.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions
CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: The high zeta potential values, necessary for the stable deposition, have been achieved by the introduction into the suspensions a nanosized SDC powder (10 wt %), obtained by laser evaporation.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: Dense composite electrolyte membranes up to 30 mm in thickness have been obtained after sintering at 1450 & DEG;C for 5 h.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: The influence of the sin-tering additives on the electrical properties of the films are studied.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: In SOFC mode, the effects of increasing the open circuit voltage (OCV) (1.06-0.92 V at the temperatures of 650-750 & DEG;C) are demonstrated as a consequence of the formation of a Ba-rich phase caused by the diffusion from the NiO-BCS substrate during sintering, which blocks the electron leakage current in the main SDC electrolyte.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: At 1450 & DEG;C, complete densification of Co -modified SDC films on the NiO-SDC anode substrate does not occur.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions

Sentencas: Therefore, the sin-tering properties are influenced by both the Ba diffusion and the sintering additives.& COPY; 2023 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions
CeO2-based thin-film electrolyte membranes for intermediate temperature SOFCs: Direct electrophoretic deposition on the supporting anode from additive-modified suspensions
